name: tacit
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
understood without being expressed directly: The decision to settle out of court was seen as a tacit admission of guilt. There was a tacit understanding that we didn't want to see each other again. Synonyms
silent
unspoken
not expressing or talking about something directly or openly: He was accused of being a tacit accomplice of imperialism. The leader has plenty of tacit supporters worldwide, including a number in Europe.
More examplesFewer examplesHe said that smugglers were operating with the tacit approval of the community.They interpreted my silence as tacit acceptance.There may be tacit or explicit resistance to these new ideas.She smiled in tacit agreement.
